isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000i and 9000i - LIGHT SYSTEMS - TROUBLESHOOTING - Stop, Tail, Turn and Hazard Signal Lights With Flasher

svcproc.title: Stop, Tail, Turn and Hazard Signal Lights With Flasher

table.title: Stop, Tail, Turn and Hazard Signal Lights With Flasher

entry.para: Do some or all of the stop lights illuminate when the brake pedal is depressed?
Remove fuse F3-B and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, replace fuse.
At F3-B measure voltage from circuit 14E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14E or 14H from battery stud (B2), then repair.
With fuse re-installed, disconnect connector (640), and at circuit 70 measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70, then repair.
With stop light switch disconnected, measure resistance across switch with brake pedal depressed.
With stop light switch disconnected, measure resistance across switch with brake pedal released.
Disconnect connector (4), and at circuit 70A measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70A, then repair.
Remove stop light relay from relay socket (464-R10), and at circuit 70D measure voltage to ground with brake pedal depressed.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70D, then repair.
At connector (464-R10) measure voltage from circuit 70D to 70-G with brake pedal depressed.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 70-G, 56-G, 57-G, or 11-G to ground stud at right dash panel, then repair.
Remove fuse F7-D and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, replace fuse.
At F7-D measure voltage from circuit 14F to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14F or 14K from battery stud (B1), then repair.
With fuse re-installed, at relay socket (464-R10), measure voltage at circuit 70E to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70E, then repair.
At relay socket (464-R10), install a test lead jumper wire between circuits 70E and 70C.
At trailer socket (112), measure voltage at circuit 70C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70C, then repair.
Remove test jumper and re-install stop light relay. At trailer socket (112), measure voltage at circuit 70C to ground with brake pedal depressed.
Remove fuse F7-B and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F7-B. At F7-B measure voltage from circuit 14L to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14L or 14K from battery stud (B1), then repair.
Remove relay (464-R11) and measure voltage to circuit 56H to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56H, then repair.
At relay socket (464-R11), install a test lead jumper wire between circuits 56H and 56C.
At trailer socket (112), measure voltage at circuit 56C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56C, then repair.
With test jumper still in place does the left turn indicator illuminate?
With test jumper still in place, disconnect connector (422), and measure voltage at circuit 56R to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56R or 56A, then repair.
With test jumper still in place, disconnect connector at (421), and measure voltage from circuit 62-GD to 56R of (422).
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 62-GD or 11-GF, then repair.
Reconnect (422) and (421). Does left turn indicator illuminate?
Remove test jumper and re-install left turn relay.
Remove fuse F7-C and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F7-C. At F7-C measure voltage from circuit 14L to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14L or 14K from battery stud (B1), then repair.
Remove relay (464-R12) and measure voltage at circuit 57H to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57H, then repair.
At relay socket (464-R12), install a test lead jumper wire between circuits 57H and 57C.
At trailer socket (112), measure voltage at circuit 57C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57C, then repair.
With test jumper still in place does the right turn indicator illuminate?
With test jumper still in place, disconnect connector (422), and measure voltage at circuit 57R to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57R or 57A, then repair.
With test jumper still in place, disconnect connector at (421), and measure voltage from circuit 62-GD to 57R of (422).
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 62-GD or 11-GF, then repair.
Reconnect (422) and (421). Does right turn indicator illuminate?
Remove test jumper and re-install left turn relay.
Remove fuse F2-D and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, replace fuse.
Re-instal fuse F2-D. At F2-D measure voltage from circuit 14R to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14R or 14K from battery stud (B1), then repair.
At flasher connector measure voltage from circuit 55 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 55, then repair.
Install a test lead jumper in place of the flasher unit.
Disconnect connector (4) at turn signal pigtail, and at circuit 55A measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 55A, then repair.
With connector (4) disconnected, move switch to left turn position and measure resistance from black wire to orange wire.
With switch in left turn position, measure resistance from black wire to yellow wire.
Move switch to right turn position and measure resistance from black wire to green wire.
With switch in right turn position, measure resistance from black wire to blue wire.
Move switch to neutral position and measure resistance from red wire to yellow wire.
With switch in the neutral position, measure resistance from red wire to green wire.
Remove left turn relay at (464-R11). Reconnect connector (4) and move turn signal switch to left turn position. At (464-R11) measure voltage from circuit 56E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56E, then repair.
Re-install left turn relay. Move turn signal switch to left turn position. Do left turn lamps illuminate?
Remove right turn relay at (464-R12). Move turn signal switch to right turn position. At (464-R12) measure voltage from circuit 57E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57E, then repair.
Re-install right turn relay. Move turn signal switch to right turn position. Do right turn lamps illuminate?
Disconnect connector (3). Move turn signal switch to left turn position, and at (3) measure voltage from circuit 56B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56B, then repair.
Move turn signal switch to right turn position, and at (3) measure voltage from circuit 57B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57B, then repair.
Reconnect connector (3), and disconnect connector (127). Move turn signal switch to left turn position, and at (127) measure voltage from circuit 56B to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56B, then repair.
Move turn signal switch to right turn position, and at (127) measure voltage from circuit 57B to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57B, then repair.
With the turn signal switch in the right turn position, at (127) measure voltage from circuit 57B to 11-GV.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GV, then repair.
Reconnect connector (127). With turn signal switch in left turn position, do the left turn lamps illuminate?
Replace defective left turn lamp or socket.
Disconnect connector (128). Move turn signal switch to right turn position, and at (128) measure voltage from circuit 57B to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57B, then repair.
With the turn signal switch in the right turn position, at (128) measure voltage from circuit 57B to 11-GN.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GN, then repair.
Reconnect connector (128). With turn signal switch in right turn position, do the right turn lamps illuminate?
Replace defective right turn lamp or socket.
Remove test jumper and re-install turn signal flasher. Do lamps flash when turn signal switch is moved to a turn position?
Stop, tail, turn, and hazard signal lights circuits check good.
